main event: Bright oval object flickered on and off at first sighting, then disappeared at a high altitude while climbing and appearing dull red.
interesting points: The observer initially thought the object was a helicopter, but later determined it was a distinct light that flickered on and off at intervals of about 4 seconds.
The object appeared stationary overhead at an estimated altitude of 2,000 feet, then disappeared at a high rate of speed in an easterly direction.
A weather balloon was launched around the time of the sighting, but it was determined that the object could not be explained by the balloon.
The report states that no possible explanation for the sighting has yet been discovered, despite the discrepancy between the balloon launch time and the sighting.
sighted object: Bright oval object that flickered on and off
